page.title: 15An Old People's Home
page.content: Wakefield Court, Leftwich, is a state controlled residence for 30 elderly women. There are 2 matrons and cleaners. It consists of separate flats and communal areas. One resident, Adena Griffiths, used to live in a bungalow on her own. She remembers the estate being built and the High School opening in 1957. Amy Potter has been here for some time. She is 82 years old and has worked for 50 years before retiring at 65. Another resident remembers playing games such as "skipping", "hop-skotch" and "tip-stone". Although the residents say they were well looked after they sometimes felt lonely and missed their old friends and neighbours. They were not allowed to keep pet animals in their flats.
